channel.title: PI Dungeoneering ideas I need some tips will Rep++
channel.description:
hey guys im adding dungeoneering to my PI server but I need some ideas on where to make the dungeons. I want to make them like runescape but dont know where some good dungeons like runscapes could be.
if you could post some coords of good dungeons to place these i will Rep++ you but dont give me taverly dungeon and other obvious dungeons i know how to google shit like that lol i just need some unique dungeons to host my dungeoneering thanks!!

@Marine5287 wrote:

I’ve noticed you posting a lot for help-remember to search in the search bar before also. ALSO pm me and I can help with some stuff(I’m good with 317’s).

item.title: PI Dungeoneering ideas I need some tips will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

owner nitro:

i have asked this topic in mopar for 2 months and ur the only one that has slightly helped me that is why im begging u to help me

As I said in my last post, you can look at the noclip command client-side. Noclip essentially sets the collision flag of each tile to 0, meaning no collision.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Dungeoneering ideas I need some tips will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

owner nitro:

Zyle do you have teamviewer cuz i will pay u 10$ for every 30 minutes u help me with this cuz u seem to know alot and i need help ill pay u 10$ every half hour u help me

Help is free. And I haven’t looked into the client in such a long time that I don’t know which classes to look at.

However, I’m sure if you asked in the Client Help section on how to change the collision flags, you might have better luck.

Although, you can look in client.java under the noclip command. That might help a little bit.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Dungeoneering ideas I need some tips will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“owner nitro, post:9, topic:392906”]thanks guys but the thing is I cant creat custom dungeons until i can find something to edit the map so i can make the area walkable…
trust me if i can find something that can do that I could make an aamazing dungeoneering system.[/quote]

Hmm. The walkable area is Handled through the cache I believe.

However, you could add a new packet, so that when the client receives it, it temporarily changes the collision flag for each tile an a certain region.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Dungeoneering ideas I need some tips will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Ddragonimp, post:2, topic:392915”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=490078.msg3583486#msg3583486 date=1303968666]
[/quote]

Code is probaly easier if you put the rooms in to a grid format… rather then runescapes premade rooms randomly spawned every where :P[/quote]

Grid format?

If all rooms are the same, and each room has 4 walls (simplest implementation), than you just need to know the north, east, south, and west rooms, to create a “grid”.

Read full topic

ill give you the codes for forgotten warriors and bosses[/quote]

That’s not even close to a “dungeoneering” type thing. That’s more of a slayer system with a boss.

item.title: PI Dungeoneering ideas I need some tips will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @owner_nitro owner nitro
item.description:
@owner_nitro wrote:

can you give me a code for make 40 tiles in each direction on coordinates 8192,8192 I will Rep++ you for it and it would help me so much!
because my only problem is i cant make object in that open space if i cant walk at all there

Read full topic
item.source: PI Dungeoneering ideas I need some tips will Rep++

item.title: PI Dungeoneering ideas I need some tips will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“owner nitro, post:3, topic:392906”]If you could tell me how to use a map editor over teamviewer or give me a tut that works for a PI I will pay you and Rep++ you and we can arrange more for you plz message back I like the way you think
also i would do the random location create thing but when u go out there you cant walk…[/quote]

I wasn’t talking about client-side. That would restrict the structure, size, and randomness of the dungeon.

What I was trying to say was usually in the starting place, there’s thieving stalls, ore rocks, some trees, etc. All you would have to do is search through your server source, find where it’s creating those objects (probably something like createGlobalObject), and then just use that method to create the dungeon.

createGlobalObject(floorTileId, x, y);
// Repeat as necessary, or (preferred) use a for loop.
createGlobalObject(wallId, x, y);
// Repeat as necessary, or (preferred) use a for loop.
createGlobalObject(treeOrWhateverId, x, y);
// Repeat as necessary, or (preferred) use a for loop.

Or what I would do is just do something like this:

public abstract class Room {
    protected Location location_;
    protected int size_;
    protected Room north_;
    protected Room east_;
    protected Room south_;
    protected Room west_;

    protected Room(Room north, Room east, Room south, Room west) {
        north_ = north;
        east_ = east;
        south_ = south;
        west_ = west;
    }

    public abstract Object[] getContents();

    public final Location getLocation() {
        return location_;
    }

    /**
     * Number of tiles in each direction for this room 
     * (consider changing to a static value to prevent odd shaped rooms)
     */
    public final int getSize() {
        return size_;
    }

    public final Room getNorthern() {
        return north_;
    }

    public final Room getEastern() {
        return east_;
    }

    public final Room getSouthern() {
        return south_;
    }

    public final Room getWestern() {
        return west_;
    }
}

public class MiningRoom extends Room {
    public MiningRoom(Room north, Room east, Room south, Room west) {
        super(north, east, south, west);
    }

    @Override
    public Object[] getContents() {
        // Here you would add the floor tile code, walls, doors, misc. objects, etc
    }
}

Note: I just whipped that up. Design is probably lacking, but you get the idea.

Read full topic

item.source: PI Dungeoneering ideas I need some tips will Rep++

item.title: PI Dungeoneering ideas I need some tips will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“owner nitro, post:1, topic:392906”]hey guys im adding dungeoneering to my PI server but I need some ideas on where to make the dungeons.
I want to make them like runescape but dont know where some good dungeons like runscapes could be.

if you could post some coords of good dungeons to place these i will Rep++ you
but dont give me taverly dungeon and other obvious dungeons i know how to google shit like that lol i just need some unique dungeons to host my dungeoneering thanks!![/quote]

I suppose you could just “create” a dungeon. For example, when people put extra ore/tables/whatever in the starting location.

You could do something like that out in the middle of no where (like 8192, 8192). First just adding the tiles (would be slightly difficult since they have no name), then adding the walls (again, no name), and then the doors and other miscellaneous objects.

A simpler way would be just to have a Room class, and then have that as a template.

I can go into more detail if you’d like (but I can’t tell you which methods to call, due to the fact that I cbf to memorize all the different names for each base).

Read full topic
